doc.after: The population of the city was 40,020 at the 1801 census, making it one of the largest cities in Britain.[46] William Thomas Beckford bought a house in Lansdown Crescent in 1822, and subsequently two adjacent houses to form his residence. Having acquired all the land between his home and the top of Lansdown Hill, he created a garden more than 1â2 mile (800Â m) in length and built Beckford's Tower at the top.[47]
